creator: nettings@apache.org
text:
the importExampleContent usecase calls PublicationUtil.getPublicationFromUrl
with the current request URL, although the method explicitly needs a webapp URL.
hence it breaks when running in non-root context. 

the error however is weird:
request is /webapp/default/authoring/?lenya.usecase=export.importExampleContent,
response is "The publication [authoring] does not exist" (buried somewhere in
the log). why "authoring"? "webapp" i would understand.

why do we have getPublicationFromUrl at all? don't we have a session with page
envelope information we could get the information from? it seems wrong to have
knowledge about the relationship between requests and publications scattered
around...
ignore me, i got my *'s and **'s wrong while trying to fix proxy issues...
creator: nettings@apache.org
